page.title: 03BUILDINGS IN RISELEY (2)
page.content: Many of the old, terraced cottages are small by today's standards and sometimes two or three have been converted into one new home. There is a great interest in the preservation of old buildings and the external appearance has to be maintained. Thatched roofs cannot be replaced by tiles. Many of the older buildings are listed buildings and need special permission if they are to be altered internally. The 'Fox and Hounds' is undergoing such alterations at the moment. The church which dates from the tenth century is the only grade one listed building in the village.
